messages.message: I also think this will be hard to justify to customers unless we can point to costs we are incurring. They might try and do this outside AI Hub otherwise
All fields regardless of type are charged the same
If they want to do outside of AI Hub they can - they just won't get all of the E2E benefits of defining the field in AI Hub  - validations, review, etc.

i just tried this out, and i didn’t see the `amount_units` consumed go up when i ran just a custom function field

i think this makes sense since we should only increase units used for calls to `ibllm` (cc @Sayd to confirm), and custom function fields don’t trigger calls to `ibllm` (cc @pauline.comising to confirm)
@hannah to confirm, are you saying that we should charge custom function fields like other fields?
Yes, the plan was that all fields should be charged the same. Unless this was decided otherwise (@Kaustubh (KD)?)
We charge based on number of fields in advanced apps. I believe Aihub Build projects charge based on ibllm calls
We only charge for "extraction" task ibllm calls. So even if derived field sends a request to ibllm, i believe it's a different task (akin to refinement)

Yep while derived fields make a `"derived_fields_refiner"` ibllm task call, custom function fields go go straight to lambda execution and don't trigger any `ibllm` call. Given sayd's point on extraction fields, we'd want to add charging for derived and custom fields if all fields should be charged the same.
Charging derived fields would be a matter of updating metronome metrics for extraction calls to include this task
Oo got it, do we know how we could update to charge for custom fields, aka a field that doesn't make an ibllm call?

This would require more work around billing on backend. Non advanced app billing is centered around ibllm calls and not tied to fields. 
cc: @Victor Zeng
